ABILITY-DAMAGE-TEXT: Daño hecho a una característica usualmente se cura al ritmo de 1 punto por día para cada característica o con hechizos como <em>Restauración menor.
ABILITY-DRAIN-TEXT: Una característica consumida sólo puede ser restablecida mediante el uso de hechizos como Restauración.
ABILITY-STR-TEXT:
El personaje sufre penalidades en:
  • Chequeos de habilidad basados en Fuerza
  • Tiradas de ataques melee
  • Tiradas de daño
  • BMC (si eres Pequeño o más grande)
  • DMC
  • Capacidad de carga
.
ABILITY-DEX-TEXT:
El personaje sufre penalidades en:
  • Chequeos de habilidad basados en Destreza
  • Tiradas de ataque de rango
  • Chequeos de iniciativa
  • Tiradas de salvación de Reflejos
  • Clase de Armadura
  • BMC (si eres Diminuto o más pequeño)
  • DMC
ABILITY-CON-TEXT:
El personaje sufre penalidades en:
  • Tiradas de salvación de Fortaleza
  • Puntos de Golpe totales por cada Dado de Golpe
Un personaje con Constitución 0 está muerto
ABILITY-INT-TEXT:
El personaje sufre penalidades en:
  • Chequeos de habilidad basados en Inteligencia
  • CDs de hechizos basados en Inteligencia
ABILITY-WIS-TEXT:
El personaje sufre penalidades en:
  • Chequeos de habilidad basados en Sabiduría
  • Tiradas de salvación de Voluntad
  • CDs de hechizos basados en Sabiduría
ABILITY-CHA-TEXT:
El personaje sufre penalidades en:
  • Chequeos de habilidad basados en Carisma
  • CDs de hechizos basados en Carisma
  • CD para resistir energía canalizada
SAVE-CRITICAL-TEXT: Usa la tirada de confirmación de crítico como la CD de salvación.
SAVE-FUMBLE-TEXT: Usa la armadura del objetivo como la CD de salvación.
UNTIL-HEALED-TEXT: Se refiere al efecto de sangrado o a cualquier daño adicional hecho, no al daño de arma o hechizo.
STATUS-BLEED-TEXT:
El personaje sufre the listed amount of damage at the beginning of its turn.
  • Bleeding can be stopped by a DC 15 Heal check or through any spell that cures hit points (even if the bleed is ability damage)
  • Bleed effects of the same kind of damage do not stack with each other, it takes the worse effect
  • Bleed expressed as a die roll is rerolled each round
STATUS-BLINDED-TEXT:
El personaje cannot see.
  • Takes a –2 penalty to Armor Class
  • Loses its Dexterity bonus to AC (if any)
  • Takes a –4 penalty on most Strength- and Dexterity-based skill checks and on opposed Perception skill checks
  • All checks and activities that rely on vision automatically fail
  • All opponents are considered to have total concealment (50% miss chance) against the blinded character
  • Blind creatures must make a DC 10 Acrobatics skill check to move faster than half speed. Creatures that fail this check fall prone
Characters who remain blinded for a long time grow accustomed to these drawbacks and can overcome some of them.
STATUS-CONFUSED-TEXT:
El personaje can't act normally and treat all creatures as enemies.
  • Casting a beneficial touch spell on it requires a melee touch attack
  • If it's attacked, it returns the attack until that creature is dead or out of sight
  • It will only make attacks of opportunity against el personaje is currently attacking
Each round, roll 1d4:
  1. Act normally
  2. Do nothing but babble incoherently
  3. Deal 1d8 + Str damage to self with item in hand
  4. Attack nearest creature (Ignoring familiar)
STATUS-DAZED-TEXT: El personaje no toma ningún acción.
STATUS-DAZZLED-TEXT:
El personaje cannot see well.
  • Takes -1 on attack rolls
  • Takes -1 on Perception checks based on sight
STATUS-DEAFENED-TEXT:
El personaje cannot hear.
  • Takes -4 on initiative checks
  • Fail any Perception checks based on sound
  • Take a –4 penalty on opposed Perception checks
  • Gains 20% chance of spell failure when casting spells with verbal components
Characters who remain deafened for a long time grow accustomed to these drawbacks and can overcome some of them.
STATUS-ENTANGLED-TEXT:
El personaje has its movement restricted.
  • Moves at half speed
  • Can't run or charge
  • Takes a –2 on attack rolls
  • Takes –4 Dex
  • Casting a spell requires a concentration check (DC 15 + spell level) or lose the spell
STATUS-EXHAUSTED-TEXT:
El personaje is depleted of energy.
  • Moves at half speed
  • Can't run or charge
  • Takes -6 to Str and Dex
After 1 hour of complete rest, an exhausted character becomes fatigued.
STATUS-FATIGUED-TEXT:
El personaje is weary.
  • Can't run or charge
  • Takes –2 to Str and Dex
  • Rest 8 hours to recover
After 8 hours of complete rest, fatigued characters are no longer fatigued. Being fatigued again causes to become exhausted.
STATUS-FLAT-FOOTED-TEXT:
El personaje is not aware of its surroundings.
  • It’s unable to react normally
  • Loses the Dex bonus to AC and CMD
  • Cannot make attacks of opportunity
STATUS-FRIGHTENED-TEXT:
El personaje is filled with fear.
  • Tries to flee from the source of its fears as best it can, using special abilities or spells if needed
  • If it's unable to flee, it may fight
  • Takes –2 on attack rolls, saving throws, skill and ability checks
STATUS-INCORPOREAL-TEXT:
El personaje doesn't have a physical body.
  • Gains immunity to nonmagical attack
  • Takes only 50% from magic weapons, spells, spell-like and supernatural effects
  • Takes full damage from other incorporeal creatures and force effects
STATUS-INVISIBLE-TEXT:
El personaje is visually undetectable, including to darkvision.
  • Gains +2 on attack rolls against sighted opponents
  • Ignores Dex bonuses to AC
  • Ignores extra damage from being a ranger's favored enemy and from sneak attacks
  • Gains 50% miss chance from total concealment. Big and slow creatures may have a lower miss chance
  • Its presence can be noticed within 30 feet with a DC 20 Perception check
  • Its current square can be pinpointed with a DC 40 Perception check
  • Character can make a touch attack with his hands or a weapon into two adjacent 5-foot squares using a standard action to check if there’s an invisible creature
See the ability details for more info and modifiers: http://paizo.com/pathfinderRPG/prd/coreRulebook/glossary.html#invisibility
STATUS-NAUSEATED-TEXT:
El personaje is experiencing stomach distress.
  • Is unable to attack, cast spells, concentrate on spells, or do anything else requiring attention
  • Can only take a single move action per turn
STATUS-PRONE-TEXT:
El personaje is lying on the ground.
  • Take –4 on melee attacks
  • Can't use ranged weapons except crossbows and firearms
  • Gains +4 AC against ranged attacks
  • Takes –4 AC against melee attacks
  • Standing up is a move action that provokes an attack of opportunity
STATUS-SHAKEN-TEXT:
El personaje is psychologically disturbed.
  • Takes –2 on attack rolls
  • Takes –2 on saving throws
  • Takes –2 on skill checks
  • Takes –2 on ability checks
STATUS-SICKENED-TEXT:
El personaje is feeling ill.
  • Takes –2 on attack rolls
  • Takes –2 on weapon damage rolls
  • Takes –2 on saving throws
  • Takes –2 on skill checks
  • Takes –2 on ability checks
STATUS-STAGGERED-TEXT:
El personaje is stupefied.
  • Can take only a single move or standard action each round
  • Can’t take full round actions
  • Can take free, swift, and immediate actions
.
STATUS-STUNNED-TEXT:
El personaje has mental numbness.
  • Drops everything held
  • Can't take actions
  • Takes a –2 penalty to AC
  • Loses the Dex bonus to AC
  • Attackers receive +4 on attack rolls to perform combat maneuvers against a stunned opponent
STATUS-UNCONSCIOUS-TEXT: El personaje is knocked out and helpless..
